page.title: 13PEOPLE OF INTEREST - DRUMOAK
page.content: Local saddler,Mr.George Sim,has lived in Drumoak all his life. He has seen the decline in his trade, starting in the late 40's when tractors became popular.Instead of repairing harness and saddles he now repairs upholstery. He can remember when the cotters (farm labourers) reared large families on a very meagre wage,the only perquisites being a rent_free house,{boll (140 lb oatmeal,milk and potatoes.Their staple diet was brose (oatmeal stirred with boiling water,seasoned with salt and eaten with milk) and porridge. The{Feein' Market}(hiring market) was held in Aberdeen.{Muckle Friday}was when the best men were employed and given{ARLES}(one shilling (5p) given on engagement) and Rascal Friday,the following week,was when the remainder of the farm workers sought employment.
